headline: Air Fryer Chicken Cordon Bleu
description: This air fryer chicken Cordon Bleu recipe featuring deli ham and gooey Swiss cheese is a deliciously crispy and satisfying main dish for two.
name: Air Fryer Chicken Cordon Bleu
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place a chicken breast on a flat work surface. Slice horizontally through the middle, being careful not to cut all the way through to the other side. Open the 2 sides and spread them out like an open book. Place chicken breast between 2 sheets of heavy plastic on a solid, level surface; lightly pound with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a 1/4-inch thickness. Repeat with remaining chicken breast.

Season each chicken breast with salt and pepper. Spread Dijon mustard on top. Place 1 slice of cheese on each breast. Top each with 2 slices of ham and 1 slice of cheese. Roll each breast up and secure with a toothpick.
Place flour in a shallow bowl. Place egg in a second bowl. Mix panko bread crumbs and grated Parmesan in a third bowl.
Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Meanwhile, dredge chicken breasts in flour; shake off excess. Dip into beaten egg, allowing any excess egg to drip back into the bowl. Press into bread crumb mixture to coat both sides; place breaded chicken breasts onto a plate and spray with nonstick spray. Let sit for 5 minutes while the air fryer preheats, then arrange breaded chicken in a single layer in the air fryer basket.

Cook in the preheated air fryer for 10 minutes; flip chicken breasts and spray any dry spots with nonstick spray. Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 8 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Recipe was good. Took a bit longer to cook, but after reaching the proper temperature it was good.
Their good. We love cheeses so should of put 4 slices in each. Other then really easy . Timing is good. Thankyou
Cooked longer than recipe said. But after 25 min WOW!!!

I cook these in the air fryer a bit longer than the recipe calls for, but they are delicious. The only alteration I made is using gluten-free breadcrumbs, but made no difference in the flavor or consistency from using regular breadcrumbs.

My entire family loved this, even my 3 year old. I served it to both of my kids with pasta sauce, huge hit. I crushed ritz crackers and used that as the coating instead of panko crumbs. I also used Maui Onion Mustard from Eastern Provisions rather than plain Dijon. Can't wait to make this again!
Made it just as it read on recipe. I made Cordon bleu sauce to go with it this is a keeper. Thank you
I'm sorry I didn't get a picture. They didn't last 5 minutes after coming out of the air fryer. Next time I will get photo.

My spouse and guest, who I made this for said it was the best thing I have ever made. I used whole grain dijon mustard and added a simple sauce of heavy cream and butter with herbs de Provence. Here is one very important tip that will help keep things together. My son is a cook and showed me how to use plastic wrap to roll up the pieces. Once rolled up, hold both ends of the wrap and spin the rolled-up deliciousness to make it tighter. Next, put this in the freezer for 45 minutes. After taking it out, do the egg wash and breading then put it back in the freezer for 45 minutes. After this, take them out and put them in the air fryer.
Amazing! We loved it!
Using my new air fry oven for this recipe
Absolutely delicious- came out nice and tender. Can’t wait to make it again!!
easy to make and ez to consume
Came out very good, nice and crispy. I added more cheese, peppers and onions inside. I will make this again.

Oh my goodness!! This was AMAZING!!! My kids even said it was the BEST thing I had ever made! I used GF flour and bread crumbs. 
Apparently my picture doesn’t meet the qualifications and there is no more for me to take a new picture! HA HA!
Loved it. Very tasty and super easy to make too. I will add more cheese to it next time.

This was delicious. There were 6 of us for dinner and they all loved it! I served it with a Ceasar Salad (Yes, I used a family size bag mix because my grandchildren love throwing it all in a big bowl and shaking it until everything is all mixed up). I will definitely make it again.
Great!! Healthy, tasty and easy. I followed directions exactly and wouldn’t change a thing. I will make it again.
Best meat entree I have had from my Ninja! Loved it!

Absolutely delicious. We both loved this recipe. I didn’t change a thing and maybe next time I’ll add some Cajun seasoning. First time with air fryer and I was very impressed with the easy prep, great results and simple cleanup. Well worth it. PJ
This turned out great. I eat gluten free and dairy free because of allergies, so I used gluten free flour and rice-based Panko. I substituted dairy free provolone for the cheese. A definite keeper.
I really enjoyed this dish. Flavorful yet not overpowering.
needs honey mustard

I used this recipe as a starting point. I swapped pounded/seasoned tenders and thighs out for the breasts; pre-cooked bacon for the ham; peppered colby-jack for the swiss; rolled in egg and parmesan/ coconut flour to keep it keto friendly; and instead of mustard inside, I made a honey, spicy mustard, mayo, sour cream dressing to put over it after air-frying. Served with a salad with the same dressing. It was tender, juicy, flavorful, and slightly crispy outside. It was a huge hit!
Very very good! It came out exactly as pictured. It was easy and delicious. I’ll definitely make it again.

This was delicious. I used gluten free panko. Its unclear how the rolling is supposed to work - I put the two halves back together after the cheese and ham and then rolled the breast. This is quite difficult as there's just too much there to roll. I don't see how rolling the open butterflied chicken breasts would work. Still, its delicious. I used Jarlsberg cheese.
Very tasty and easy to make.
I seldom review a recipe, but this one is truly 5 star. My only change was to use Italian bread crumbs instead of panko. The chicken was moist and and flavorful. Fantastic.
I pounded my chicken to make it easier to handle. Added smoked Gouda and prosciutto. Took closer to 35 minutes for the inner chicken was still raw at 20 minutes. Pretty standard recipe.
Would add more spice and use cheddar cheese but well worth it.
It had to cook a lot longer than the time given. A lot
